default: (a) a {@item longsword|phb}, (b) a {@item rapier|phb}, (c) a {@item shortsword|phb}, (d) a {@item warhammer|phb} or (e) any {@filter simple melee weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=u~u~sand}
(a) a {@item light crossbow|phb} and 20 bolts or (b) a {@item shortbow|phb} and 20 arrows
(a) {@item leather armor|phb}, (b) {@item scale mail|phb} or (c) {@item chain mail|phb} (if proficient)
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item scholar's pack|phb}
a {@item holy symbol|phb}, {@item inquisitorial symbol of office|FoxfireInquisitor} and a {@item dagger|phb}

classFeature.name: Inquisitorial Order
entries: Choose from one of the Inquisitorial Orders from the list of available orders, each of which focuses on hunting a particular type of foe. Your chosen order gives you features at 1st, 3rd, 6th, 10th, 15th and 18th levels.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: At 1st level, you have learned to draw on divine magic through meditation and prayer to cast spells as a cleric does. This font of magic, with careful meditation and practice, fuels your spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know one cantrip of your choice from the inquisitor spell list. You learn additional inquisitor cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Inquisitor table.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Inquisitor table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your inquisitor spells. To cast one of your inquisitor spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of inquisitor spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the inquisitor spell list. When you do so, choose a number of inquisitor spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + half your inquisitor level, rounded down (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 5th-level inquisitor, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Wisdom of 14, your list of prepared spells can include four spells of 1st or 2nd-level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell command|PHB}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or a 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of inquisitor spells requires time spent in practice and meditation: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your inquisitor spells, since the power of your magic relies on your ability to project your will into the world. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a inquisitor spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use your {@item inquisitorial symbol of office|FoxfireInquisitor} and/or your {@item holy symbol|PHB} as a spellcasting focus for your inquisitor spells.

classFeature.name: Inquisitorial Retinue
entries: {@i 1st-level inquisitor {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
If your DM allows it, starting at 1st level you may employ a small retinue of followers.

Choose from the following list (duplicates allowed): {@creature Acolyte|MM}, {@creature Apprentice Wizard|VGM}, {@creature Archer|VGM}, {@creature Bard|VGM}, {@creature Commoner|MM}, {@creature Druid|MM}, {@creature Guard|MM}, {@creature Illusionist|VGM}, {@creature Knight|MM}, {@creature Martial Arts Adept|VGM}, {@creature Noble|MM}, {@creature Priest|MM}, {@creature Scout|MM}, {@creature Spy|MM}, {@creature Swashbuckler|VGM}, {@creature Thug|MM}, {@creature Tribal Warrior|MM}, and {@creature Veteran|MM}. You can only make choices up to the maximum CR/limit for your level.
Each follower has a salary of 10 gp x CR a week (minimum 10 gp) and they are controlled by the DM, but follow your orders as long as they're not outright suicidal.

The methods by which you can hire your retinue will be determined by your DM. They could be with you from the start, hired via a recruitment notice, hired from NPCs you meet in your travels or however else your DM sees fit.

classFeature.name: Unorthodox Armoury
entries: {@i 1st-level inquisitor {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
If your DM allows it, at 1st level you may exchange one or more of your martial melee weapon proficiencies for a different martial melee weapon.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 2nd level you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

entries.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

entries.name: Blessed Warrior
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter cleric spell list|spells|level=0|class=Cleric}. They count as inquisitor spells for you, and Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the cleric spell list.

entries.name: Blind Fighting
entries: You have blindsight with a range of 10 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're {@condition blinded} or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an {@condition invisible} creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

entries.name: Interception
entries: When a creature you can see hits a target, other than you, within 5 feet of you with an attack, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage the target takes by {@dice 1d10} + your proficiency bonus (to a minimum of 0 damage). You must be wielding a {@item shield|phb} or a {@filter simple or martial weapon|items|source=phb;FFItemsGalore=u~u~sor|category=basic|type=simple weapon;martial weapon=u~u~sor} to use this reaction.

entries.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

classFeature.name: Judgement
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you issue a divine judgement against a number of creatures equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) you can see within 30 feet of you as an action.

Each judgement lasts for 1 minute and ends early if the target dies, you die or if you are {@condition incapacitated}; if you use another judgement whilst one is already active the effects of the first judgement immediately end. Some effects require saving throws, these use your inquisitor spell save DC.
When you use this feature, you must select one type of judgement to make:

entries.name: Destruction
entries: You invite divine wrath upon a creature, granting a +3 bonus to all damage rolls you make against each target. At 9th level this increases to +6, and to +9 at 17th level.

entries.name: Justice
entries: Misfortune addles your foe's attempts to act or save themselves, each creature subtracts {@dice 1d4} from the number rolled for any ability check or saving throw it makes. At 9th level this increases to {@dice 1d6}, and to {@dice 1d8} at 17th level.

entries.name: Piercing
entries: The resilience of your foes wavers against your divine proclamation; whenever a target takes damage that it has a resistance to, it must succeed a Constitution saving throw or lose the resistance to that damage type until the start of its next turn. At 17th level, if the target takes damage it is immune to, it must succeed a Constitution saving throw otherwise its immunity is treated as resistance until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Punishment
entries: Your foe's attempts to resist are naught but folly, each target must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or subtract {@dice 1d4} from all attack and damage rolls it makes for the duration. At 9th level this increases to {@dice 1d6}, and to {@dice 1d8} at 17th level.

entries.name: Restriction
entries: The weight of your foe's sins stays their feet, each target must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or their movement speed is halved and they are unable to take the {@action Dash} action for the duration. At 9th level, their movement speed instead becomes 0. At 17th level, the target also falls {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Silence
entries: The heretical speech of your foe falters, each target must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or be unable to speak for the duration. At 9th level they also become unable to concentrate on spells.

entries.name: Sunder
entries: Armour offers little protection for your foes as righteous weapons find their mark, each target must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or their AC is reduced by 1 for the duration. At 9th level this increases to 2, and to 3 at 17th level.
At 2nd level you can this feature once, at 7th level you can use this feature twice, and three times at 17th level. You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Inquisitorial Order Feature
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a feature granted by your Inquisitorial Order.

classFeature.name: Radical Inquisitors
entries: {@i 3rd-level inquisitor {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}

Some Inquisitors aren't heretical from the outset, nor do some consider themselves heretics at all, these radicals at some point in their careers diverged from their more puritan peers and dabbled with what is considered forbidden.

If your DM allows it, starting at 3rd level when you gain a level in this class where you would get a feature from your subclass you may instead replace it with a feature from the Hereticus subclass of the same level instead as indicated in the Radical Inquisitor below table.
For example, a Witch Hunter Inquisitor upon reaching 6th level in this class could take the Arcane Drain feature instead of Psychic Backlash.

rows: {@subclassFeature Veteran of the Long Hunt|Inquisitor|FoxfireInquisitor|Monster Hunter|FoxfireInquisitor|18}

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Inquisitorial Order Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Inquisitorial Order.

classFeature.name: Judgement (two uses)
entries: At 7th level, you gain a second use of your judgement feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Inquisitorial Order Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Inquisitorial Order.

classFeature.name: Expert Interrogator
entries: At 11th level your formidable reputation precedes you and next to no one can withstand your scrutiny.

You gain proficiency in {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation} and {@skill Investigation} skills; if you are already proficient in one of those skills then your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with that skill.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Cunning Initiative
entries: At 14th level you use your wits to gain an edge in battle. You gain a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

classFeature.name: Inquisitorial Order Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Inquisitorial Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Judgement (three uses)
entries: At 17th level, you gain a third use of your judgement feature.

classFeature.name: Inquisitorial Order Feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature granted by your Inquisitorial Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Final Judgement
entries: At 20th level you can, as an action, present your holy symbol and speak a final judgement upon a foe. Choose one creature within 15 feet of you, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. If it fails and has 100 hit points or less, it is reduced to 0 hit points. If it succeeds or has more than 100 hit points, it takes {@damage 10d10} radiant or necrotic damage (your choice).
You regain the use of this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Daemon Hunters
entries: An order of inquisitors dedicated to hunting errant "daemons"—their collective term for celestials, fey, and fiends—the members of this order track down and slay any such daemon that dabbles maliciously in mortal affairs.
At each indicated inquisitor level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Daemon Hunter Order Spells
rows: {@spell aura of life}, {@spell shadow of moil|xge}
{@spell dispel evil and good}, {@spell wall of light|xge}

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrips
entries: When you choose this order at 1st level, you gain the {@spell sacred flame|PHB} and {@spell word of radiance|XGE} cantrips in addition to your chosen cantrips.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency with martial weapons and heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Forceful Smite
entries: Starting when you join this order, you're able to strike your weapons against your sworn foes with especially malicious force.

Once per turn, when you hit a celestial, fey or fiend with a melee weapon attack, you can deal an additional {@damage 1d4} force damage. This increases to {@damage 2d4} at 10th level, and {@damage 3d4} at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Aegis Ward
entries: Starting at 3rd level you learn to protect yourself from the insidious attacks of your foes. When making a saving throw, you can expend one use of this feature to gain advantage on the roll. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Grimoire of True Names
entries: At 6th level you gain access to a Grimoire of True Names, a book containing the collected true names of each celestial, fey and fiend encountered by daemon-hunting inquisitors.

As an action you may choose a single celestial, fey, or fiend you can see within 60 feet of you and attempt to speak aloud their true name. Make an Intelligence (History) check with a DC equal to 13 or the creature's CR (which ever is higher). On a successful roll the target takes {@damage 8d8} psychic damage. You have advantage on the Intelligence (History) check if you have used this creature's true name before.
You gain a number of uses of this feature equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Baneful Aura
entries: Starting at 10th level your presence has become an anathema to your foes; all celestials, fey, and fiends within 15 feet of you have disadvantage on all saving throws.

Additionally, as an action, you can choose one creature you can see within 15 feet of you. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save the creature has disadvantage on all saving throws for 1 minute whilst within 15 feet of you; on a success the creature is immune to your baneful aura for 24 hours.
Once you've used your aura in this way, you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Forceful Smite Improvement
entries: At 10th level the damage of your Forceful Smite increases to {@damage 2d4}.

subclassFeature.name: Strike True
entries: At 15th level you've fought your foes for so long you can predict their defences and break through them with an ease born of experience. As a bonus action on your turn, you can give yourself advantage on weapon attack rolls against celestials, fey and fiends until the start of your next turn.
You can use this feature three times, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Unfaltering Determination
entries: At 18th level none can stand against your will, none can cause you to falter and none can twist you to their schemes. You become immune to being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened} and {@condition stunned}.

subclassFeature.name: Forceful Smite Improvement
entries: At 10th level the damage of your Forceful Smite increases to {@damage 3d4}.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Witch Hunters
entries: The bane of mages across the land, this order of inquisitors hunts down and slays rogue spellcasters; using their esoteric abilities to shrug off magic with disturbing ease.
At each indicated inquisitor level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Witch Hunter Order Spells
rows: {@spell aura of purity}, {@spell otiluke's resilient sphere}

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrips
entries: When you choose this order at 1st level, you gain the {@spell control flames|XGE} and {@spell create bonfire|XGE} cantrips in addition to your chosen cantrips.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Disruption
entries: When you join this order you learn how to counteract the foul machinations of malcontent mages. As a reaction to a creature casting a spell within 30 feet of you that you can see, you can attempt to stop the spell from being cast.

Roll a Wisdom ability check against the spellcaster's spell save DC, adding your proficiency bonus to your roll. On a success you may expend a spell slot of equal level or higher than the target's spell to stop it being cast. If you don't have a spell slot of the correct level remaining, the disruption fails and the spell is cast as normal. You may disrupt cantrips without expending a spell slot.
The range for this feature increases to 45 feet at 10th level and to 60 feet at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Piercing Gaze
entries: Starting at 3rd level few can hide from your eyes for long, you gain advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks to see invisible creatures and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks to determine illusions.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Backlash
entries: Starting at 6th level your magic disruption sends a surge of energy back into the caster's mind.

When you make a successful roll using your spell disruption feature to stop a spell of 1st level or higher, the target creature takes a number of {@dice d8} equal to the spell's level in psychic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Absorption
entries: Beginning at 10th level you have built up a bulwark against foul sorcery; you have resistance to damage from spells.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Disruption Improvement
entries: At 10th level the range for this feature increases to 45 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Oculum Arcanis
entries: At 15th level you gain access to an Oculum Arcanis, a mystic seeing device. The first attack roll you make on your turn against a creature within 30 feet of you that can cast spells is made with advantage.
Additionally as a bonus action you may use your oculum arcanis to gain 30 feet of true sight for 1 hour; when you do so, you lose the other benefit of this feature until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hexagrammic Wards
entries: At 18th level you learn how to cast powerful wards that can shield you or your allies from harm. As a action you may choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you (including yourself), the creature gains immunity to damage from magical weapon attacks and spells until the end of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Disruption Improvement
entries: At 18th level the range for this feature increases to 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Monster Hunters
entries: Experts adept at tracking and taking down all manner of foul and warped creatures, the inquisitors of this order are invaluable when fighting beastly threats.
At each indicated inquisitor level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Monster Hunter Order Spells
rows: {@spell detect poison and disease}, {@spell hunter's mark}

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrips
entries: When you choose this order at 1st level, you gain the {@spell infestation|XGE} and {@spell poison spray|PHB} cantrips in addition to your chosen cantrips.

subclassFeature.name: Preferred Prey
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you have significant experience studying, tracking, and hunting a certain type of enemy.
Choose a type of preferred prey: beasts, humanoids, or monstrosities. You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with weapon attacks against creatures of the chosen type.
Additionally, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track your preferred prey, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

Whenever you finish a long rest, you can change one of your chosen types of Preferred Prey, choosing a different type from the options available for your current level. Once you use do so, you cannot change it again for 30 days.

subclassFeature.name: Know Your Quarry
entries: At 3rd level you can use your bonus action to choose one creature you can see and make a Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) check to recall knowledge of the enemy creature's tactics; using the creature's challenge rating or level (whichever is higher, minimum of 1) as the DC. On a successful roll, you gain advantage on saving throws against the spells and effects of that creature for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Pinning Strike
entries: Starting at 6th level you learn how to efficiently trap your prey, holding them in place for you to strike. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks against a creature within 60 feet of you with a pinning strike.

Make the attack roll as normal and on a hit, in addition to the attack's normal damage, the creature must succeed a Strength saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your attack's ability score modifier or become {@condition incapacitated} and {@condition restrained} until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Predator's Knowledge
entries: Starting at 10th level you apply your practical experience in the field to enhance your attacks. Once per turn, you can add half your Wisdom modifier (rounded down, minimum of 1) to the attack roll or the damage roll of an attack you make against one of your preferred prey. At 15th level you can add your full Wisdom modifier.

Additionally you can choose another type of Preferred Prey from the following list: aberrations, constructs, dragons, elementals, or giants, or another from the list in that class feature. Your bonus to damage rolls against all your Preferred Prey increases to +4.

subclassFeature.name: Stamina Siphon
entries: At 15th level you can sap the stamina of your foes to undermine their defences. You can use your action to target a creature you can see within 30 feet of you, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC.
On a failed save they suffer 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion} and all attack rolls against the creature have advantage until the end of your next turn.
You regain the use of this feature once you have finished a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Predator's Knowledge Improvement
entries: At 15th level you can add your full Wisdom modifier to the attack roll or the damage roll of an attack you make against one of your preferred prey.

subclassFeature.name: Veteran of the Long Hunt
entries: After so long chasing your quarry, you know just how to bring them down. At 18th level you gain advantage on attack rolls against the target of your Know Your Quarry feature.
Additionally if the target's creature type is the same as one of your preferred prey, you automatically succeed the Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) check.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Grave Wardens
entries: Inquisitors of this order, as the name may suggest, preserve the sanctity of life by rooting out and destroying the creatures of the undead; from the lowliest vampire to the most ancient lich, none escape their watch.
At each indicated inquisitor level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrips
entries: When you choose this order at 1st level, you gain the {@spell chill touch|PHB} and {@spell green-flame blade|TCE} cantrips in addition to your chosen cantrips.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: When you join this order you learn how to arm yourself to better fight the undead. You gain proficiency with {@item heavy crossbow|PHB|heavy crossbows}, as well as {@item Woodcarver's Tools|PHB} and may spend 1 hour using the tools with a small supply of wood to craft a {@item wooden stake|FoxfireInquisitor}.

A {@item wooden stake|FoxfireInquisitor} is a simple melee weapon with the light and thrown (20/60) properties, on a hit it deals {@dice 1d4} piercing damage. It may also be used in place of crossbow bolts as ammunition.

You may also create {@item Holy Water (flask)|PHB|holy water} by performing a special ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour to perform, uses 25 gp worth of powdered silver, and requires you to expend a 1st-level spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Spurn Death's Touch
entries: Members of this order are typically chosen from those with impressive mental fortitude in the face of their enemies.

At 3rd level whenever you must make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw against a spell or effect you can expend one use of this feature to gain advantage on the roll. If the spell or effect is from an Undead creature, you don't expend a use.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Turn Undead
entries: Starting at 3rd level you can, as an action, present your holy symbol and speak a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the {@action Dash} action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the {@action Dodge} action.
You can use this feature once, and may use it twice at 15th level. When you finish a short or long rest, you regain your expended uses.

subclassFeature.name: Mortal Respite
entries: At 6th level you learn sacred rites that can impede an undead assault for a brief time. As an action you can present your holy symbol and do one of the following:

entries.name: Calm the Soul
entries: Choose a number of creatures you can see within 30 feet equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). A target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC, it does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it and with disadvantage if it is undead. If it fails the saving throw, it is {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The {@condition charmed} creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. When the effect ends, the creature knows it was {@condition charmed} by you.

entries.name: Stillness of the Grave
entries: Choose a number of undead creatures you can see within 30 feet equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). A target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute and fall {@condition prone}. At the end of each of its turns, a target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the {@condition paralyzed} condition ends on the target.
You regain the use of this feature once you have finished a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Warden's Vigilance
entries: At 10th level you understand how to efficiently combat several varieties of undead, and gain the following benefits:
You are immune to being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by undead creatures.
If you reduce a creature with the Undead Fortitude trait to 0 hit points with a melee attack, ranged attack or a spell, the trait does not function and the creature dies.
Once per turn when you hit an undead creature that has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage from nonmagical attacks, your attack ignores that resistance.

subclassFeature.name: Final Death
entries: At 15th level you are able to prevent undead from returning or new undead being created with your killing blows.
Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, ranged attack or a spell, the creature can't become undead by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell for the next 7 days.
If the creature is already undead and of CR 15 or lower, it is instantly destroyed instead.

subclassFeature.name: Positive Energy Burst
entries: At 18th level you can emit of a burst of positive energy as an action. Each creature within 30 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, undead creatures do so with disadvantage. They take {@damage 12d6} radiant damage on failed save or half as much on a successful one.
You regain the use of this feature once you have finished a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Overseers
entries: Clandestine peacekeepers, the overseers are an order order of watchmen and investigators. Capable of uncovering all manner of gossip and rumour, they keep public order with the helpful eyes of their shapeshifting companions.
At each indicated inquisitor level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Overseer Order Spells
rows: {@spell rary's telepathic bond}, {@spell wall of stone}

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrips
entries: When you choose this order at 1st level, you gain the {@spell lightning lure|TCE} and {@spell prestidigitation} cantrips in addition to your chosen cantrips.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Additionally at 1st level you gain proficiency with the {@item disguise kit|PHB}, the {@item forgery kit|PHB}, and one {@filter gaming set|items|type=gaming set} of your choice. You also learn two languages of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Local Liaison
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you gain the skills you need to fulfil your overseer duties. During a short or long rest in an area such as a city or village, you can spend up to 1 hour acquiring useful information about the local area. To do so make a Wisdom ({@skill Investigation}) check and consult the table below. During this you can spend gold on materials, bribes, gifts, and other expenses, gaining a +1 bonus to your roll for every 10 gp you spend, up to a maximum of 50 gp.

entries.caption: Investigation Outcomes
rows: You learn one piece of local lore.
You learn two pieces of local lore.
You learn three pieces of local lore.

entries: Each piece of lore is the equivalent of one true statement about a person, place, or thing. Examples include knowledge of a creature's resistances, the password needed to enter an exclusive establisment, the rota of the local guard barracks, and so on. The DM ultimately determines what you may learn, and may decide to alter the above table depending on your location.
You still gain the full benefits of your rest even if you use this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Loyal Watcher
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to use your magic to create a powerful bond with a spirit known as a {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor}.

You magically call forth a spirit known as a {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor} that is friendly to you and your companions and obeys your commands. The spirit's corporeal form uses the {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor} stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places. You determine which form it takes—Crow or Hound—and its overall animal appearance, a kind appropriate for the chosen form. For example a Hound {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor} could appear akin to a Mastiff or a Wolf, while a Crow {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor} could look like a Raven or an Owl.

The {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor} obeys your commands as best it can. It rolls for initiative like any other creature, but you determine its actions, decisions, attitudes, and so on. If you are incapacitated or absent, the {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor} acts on its own.
For each level you gain after 3rd, the {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor} gains an additional hit die and increases its hit points accordingly.

Whenever you gain the Ability Score Improvement class feature, the {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor}'s abilities also improve. The {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor} can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or it can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1; the {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor} can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

While the {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor} is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as an action, you can see through the {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor}'s eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor} has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.

If the {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor} has died within the last hour, you can use your action to touch it and expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher. The {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor} returns to life after 1 minute with all its hit points restored.

When you finish a long rest, you can change the form of the {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor}—from Crow to Hound, or vice-versa—or resummon the {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor} if it has died. The {@creature Watcher|FoxfireInquisitor} vanishes if you die.

subclassFeature.name: Compel Evidence
entries: At 6th level you know just how to extract the information you need from someone. As an action you present your holy symbol and choose a creature you can see within 10 feet of you, they must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save creature can't speak a deliberate lie when you ask it a question. The effect ends on the creature when you have asked it 5 questions or after 10 minutes.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Well-Trained
entries: At 6th level, while the Watcher can see you, it has advantage on all saving throws. In addition, the Watcher's attacks now count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Lights Out
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you deal bludgeoning damage to a creature you can force them to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns and whenever it takes damage, ending the condition on a success.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Rabble Rouser
entries: At 15th level you can use your action to inflame the ire of those around you. Choose a number of creatures up to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) that are within 30 feet of you. The chosen creatures may add your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) to one ability check, attack roll, damage roll or saving throw on their turn. A creature that is {@condition deafened} or otherwise can't hear you is unaffected. If a creature moves further than 30 feet away from you on their turn they no longer receive this bonus unless they are once again within 30 feet of you at the start of their next turn whilst this feature is still active.

Once started, you can continue this effect on each of your turns as a bonus action for up to 1 minute. The effects of this feature end either after 1 minute or at the end of one of your turns where you do not continue it with your bonus action.
You must finish a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Training
entries: At 15th level, whenever an attacker that the Watcher can see hits it with an attack, it can use its reaction to halve the attack's damage against it. Additionally whenever the Watcher takes the Attack action, it can make two attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Compelled Compliance
entries: Starting at 18th level you can compel others to comply with just your voice. As an action, choose a number of creatures up to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) that you can see within 60 feet. Each creature must succeed a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition charmed} by you until the start of your next turn.

On a {@condition charmed} target's turn, you can verbally control the target's move, action or both. When controlled in this way, the target can only take the {@action Attack} or {@action Dash} actions. A creature that is immune to being {@condition charmed}, is {@condition deafened}, or otherwise can't hear you automatically succeeds the saving throw.
Once you use this feature you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Iconoclasts
entries: A controversial order of Inquisitors the Iconoclasts seek out and destroy religious artifacts they deem heretical and silence heathen demagogues. However the order does face accusations of hypocrisy for its rumoured practice of using some of the relics they encounter against their foes.
At each indicated inquisitor level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrips
entries: When you choose this order at 1st level, you gain the {@spell fire bolt} and {@spell mind sliver|TCE} cantrips in addition to your chosen cantrips.

subclassFeature.name: Mental Fortitude
entries: When you join this order at 1st level you are put through rigorous training to ensure your mind cannot be swayed by those you will be tasked to seek out. You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and against effects from magic items.
At 15th level, you become immune to being {@condition charmed}.

subclassFeature.name: Censor Opposition
entries: Also at 1st level you learn how to castigate heretical demagogues. As a bonus action you present your holy symbol and choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of you, they must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature can't speak or cast spells with verbal components for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect early on a success.
Additionally at 15th level a creature who fails the saving throw can only take the {@action Dash} or {@action Dodge} actions while under this effect.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Profane Reliquary
entries: At 3rd level you've collected a variety of religious contraband in your travels and now as per the doctrine of your order you turn the heretics own power against them, although not always without risk. Choose two options from the list available in the {@filter Profane Reliquary|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Profane Relic}. For a creature other than yourself, the relics are mundane items. Whenever you finish a long rest you can replace up to two of your choices for new ones.
At 10th level you may choose up to four options from the Profane Reliquary, and at 18th level you may choose up to six.

subclassFeature.name: Antimagic Strike
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you hit a creature with a melee attack you can force them to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save any active spell or other magical effect on the creature as well as the properties and powers of any magic items they are wearing are suppressed until the end of your next turn. At 15th level this increases to 1 minute.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Esoteric Loremaster
entries: Starting at 10th level the knowledge you've acquired along your journey begins to pay dividends. You have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) and Intelligence ({@skill Religion}) skill checks.

subclassFeature.name: Profane Reliquary Improvement
entries: At 10th level you may choose up to four options from the {@filter Profane Reliquary|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Profane Relic}.

subclassFeature.name: Damnatio Memoriae
entries: Starting at 15th level you can expel a creature from the plane, even condeming the memory of them in those that remain. As an action you present your holy symbol and choose a creature you can see within 15 feet of you, they must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC.

If the creature fails the save, it is transported to a random location on the ethereal plane. A creature so transported must find its own way back to your current plane of existence. After 30 days of being on the ethereal plane all memory of the creature (except yours) begins to disappear with the creature being completely forgotten after 1 year; when the creature leaves the ethereal plane all memory of it returns to normal.
Once you use this feature you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Mental Fortitude Improvement
entries: At 15th level, you become immune to being {@condition charmed}.

subclassFeature.name: Censor Opposition Improvement
entries: At 15th level a creature who fails the saving throw can only take the {@action Dash} or {@action Dodge} actions while under the effect of your {@subclassFeature Censor Opposition|Inquisitor|FoxfireInquisitor|Iconoclast|FoxfireInquisitor|1} feature.

subclassFeature.name: Antimagic Strike Improvement
entries: At 15th level the duration for the effect of your {@subclassFeature Antimagic Strike|Inquisitor|FoxfireInquisitor|Iconoclast|FoxfireInquisitor|6} increases to 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Eradicate Artifact
entries: At 18th level you are determined and capable enough to even undo the magic infused into items, rendering them mundane or simply destroying them outright although such an undertaking is not completely reliable.

You can spend 7 days in uninterrupted study and contemplation as to the nature of a single magic item in your possession; at the end of the 7 days you must make a spellcasting ability check against a DC that varies depending on the rarity of the item shown in the table below. On a success the item is destroyed and turns to dust; on a failure you cannot use this feature on the same artifact again although another Iconoclast could.

subclassFeature.name: Profane Reliquary Improvement
entries: At 18th level you may choose up to six options from the {@filter Profane Reliquary|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Profane Relic}.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Vigilants
entries: Some Inquisitors, such as those of this order, focus not on directly hunting their foes but instead defending their allies and the innocent during their work. Able to command their fellows to excel in combat as well as keep their morale resolute, the Vigilants are ready for trouble at any moment.
At each indicated inquisitor level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrips
entries: When you choose this order at 1st level, you gain the {@spell shocking grasp} and {@spell spare the dying} cantrips in addition to your chosen cantrips.

subclassFeature.name: One Eye's Always Open
entries: Starting when you join this order you're rigorously drilled to expect treachery and trouble at every turn, keeping a watchful eye out at all times.
You can't be surprised while you are conscious and other creatures don't gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.
Additionally you gain proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Judgement
entries: Also at 1st level, when you target one or more creatures with your Destruction Judgement you can choose one friendly creature within 30 feet of you to also gain the bonus to damage rolls against the Judgement's target.
At 10th level you may choose up to two friendly creatures, and up to three at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Tactics
entries: Starting at 3rd level you can use your bonus action to issue orders to aid your allies in combat, choosing one of the options below:

items.name: With me, as one!
entries: Choose up to 3 friendly creatures you can see within 30 feet of you, they gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls against the next creature you hit before the end of your next turn.

items.name: Rally to me!
entries: Choose up to 3 friendly creatures you can see within 30 feet of you, they all gain temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d10} + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

items.name: Hold the line!
entries: Choose up to 3 friendly creatures you can see within 30 feet of you which may include yourself; they may use their reaction to make a single melee attack against another creature that enters their weapon's reach before the end of your next turn.
You can use this feature twice and regain all expended uses after you finish a short or long rest. You gain two additional uses of this feature at 10th level and another two uses at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Shield
entries: At 6th level you are able to protect your allies by taking some of the brunt to spare them harm. When a friendly creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by half (rounded down) however you take damage of the same type equal to the amount reduced.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bolstered Resolve
entries: Starting at 10th level you inspire your allies during times of rest, granting them greater vigour. Whenever you finish a long rest you can choose a number of creatures—which may include yourself—up to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), each creature gains temporary hit points equal to your level.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Judgement Improvement
entries: At 10th level you may choose up to two friendly creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Tactics Improvement
entries: At 10th level you gain two additional uses of your {@subclassFeature Combat Tactics|Inquisitor|FoxfireInquisitor|Vigilant|FoxfireInquisitor|3} feature, for a total of four.

subclassFeature.name: Ever At The Ready
entries: At 15th level when you and any creatures of your choice within 15 feet of you roll initiative, they gain a bonus to their initiative equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

Additionally friendly creatures within 10 feet of you gain a bonus to their passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and passive Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) scores equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Stalwart Vigil
entries: At 18th level no enemies can escape the watchful eyes of you or break the resolve of your allies. As an action, you present your holy symbol, and eyes aglow you emanate a bulwark of alertness, gaining the following benefits for 1 minute or until you are incapacitated or die:
You gain truesight with a range of 60 feet.
You, and friendly creatures within 30 feet of you, have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition stunned}.
Whenever a friendly creature ends its turn withing 30 feet of you, it gains temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your inquisitor level.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th-level spell slot to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Judgement Improvement
entries: At 18th level you may choose up to three friendly creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Tactics Improvement
entries: At 18th level you gain two additional uses of your {@subclassFeature Combat Tactics|Inquisitor|FoxfireInquisitor|Vigilant|FoxfireInquisitor|3} feature, for a total of six.

subclassFeature.name: Excommunicate Hereticus
entries: Inquisitors who stray too far into forbidden knowledge and lore or whom too readily use tainted power find themselves branded Excommunicate Hereticus, or Heretics for short. These are dangerous individuals for whom any means are justified no matter how damning they may be.
At each indicated inquisitor level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrips
entries: When you choose this order at 1st level, you gain the {@spell warp lightning|FoxfireInquisitor} and {@spell wrack|FoxfireInquisitor} cantrips in addition to your chosen cantrips.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Heretical Inquisitors rarely follow the doctrines of their orders for long, specialising with whatever suits their own goals. At 1st level you can choose two of the following options:
You gain proficiency with the {@item forgery kit|PHB} & {@item thieves' tools|PHB}.
You gain proficiency with the {@item disguise kit|PHB} and one {@filter gaming set|items|type=gaming set} of your choice.
You gain proficiency with martial weapons.
You gain proficiency with heavy armour.
You learn two languages of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Prodigy of Deceit
entries: Additionally at 1st level you learn to mask your untoward activites using your wits and guile. You gain a bonus to Charisma ({@skill Deception}) checks and Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 0).

subclassFeature.name: Unsavoury Allies
entries: {@i 1st-level hereticus inquisitor {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}

If your DM allows it, starting at 1st level you may choose additional options for your {@classFeature Inquisitorial Retinue|Inquisitor|FoxfireInquisitor|1}. You may also choose from the following in addition to the previous options in the list: {@creature Bandit|MM}, {@creature Bandit Captain|MM}, {@creature Berserker|MM}, {@creature Cult Fanatic|MM}, {@creature Cultist|MM} and {@creature Daemonhost|FoxfireInquisitor}.
Summoning a Daemonhost involves binding a celestial, fey, or fiend to a living humanoid host during a long blood-fueled ritual that requires the following:
A living humanoid creature.
The name of a celestial, fey, or fiend who's CR or level is equal to or less than your level.
A 5th level spell slot.
A non-magical {@item dagger|PHB}.

When you begin the ritual you take {@damage 1d4} slashing damage, which can't be reduced in any way, as you cut open your hand and draw a circle with the dagger dipped in your blood, before carving intricate runes and wards of binding into the flesh of the humanoid creature, which also takes {@damage 1d4} slashing damage, which can't be reduced in any way.

You then chant the name of the celestial, fey, or fiend which must be on the same plane of existence as you. The ritual requires concentration, as if concentrating on a spell. If you lose concentration on the ritual it fails.

After 8 hours the named celestial, fey or fiend must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC, with disadvantage if you used it's true name, which it can choose to fail. The humanoid creature must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC, which it can choose to fail.

If both creatures fail their saving throws you expend a 5th level spell slot and the ritual succeeds. The chosen celestial, fey or fiend is bound into the humanoid creature whose statblock is replaced with the Daemonhost stat block, with the creature's type changing to match the type of the bound creature.

The Daemonhost follows the same rules for other members of your retinue, although it can't disobey your commands unless it succeeds a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC and it does not require a salary.

If a Daemonhost dies, or if it is targeted by the break enchantment effect of {@spell dispel evil and good|PHB}, the celestial, fey or fiend used in the ritual appears within an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the Daemonhost.

subclassFeature.name: Control Person
entries: Starting at 3rd level you learn how to bend the minds of others to your will. As an action you present your {@item inquisitorial symbol of office|FoxfireInquisitor} and chant an incantation, choosing one humanoid you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target must obey your commands for 1 minute. A humanoid whose challenge rating is equal to or greater than your level is immune to this effect.
You can use this feature once, and may use it twice at 15th level. When you finish a long rest, you regain your expended uses.

subclassFeature.name: Corruption
entries: {@i 3rd-level hereticus inquisitor {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
All power demands sacrifice, and forbidden power is pricier still. Such knowledge comes at a cost, but not one that might be immediately apparent.
If your DM allows it, from 3rd level whenever you gain a non-optional feature from the Hereticus subclass you also gain one level of corruption.

rows: You become steadily more paranoid and suspicious of others and their motivations.
You begin to appear more gaunt and pallid, regardless of your actual health.
Your voice begins to take on a sibilant rasp.
You gain some sort of physical change: from sprouting curved black horns or your eyes becoming black to your skin turning to scales or your teeth becoming jagged.
You gain an {@variantrule madness|DMG|Indefinite Madness} that can't be cured except by a {@spell wish|PHB} spell.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Drain
entries: At 6th level you learn how to utilise vulnerable openings during the casting of spells to steal the very life from your foes and channel it into yourself. As a reaction to a creature casting a spell within 30 feet of you, you can attempt to siphon their life force. Make an opposed ability check using your spellcasting ability against the target's spellcasting ability.

On a success, the creature takes a number of {@damage d6} equal to the spell's level in necrotic damage and you regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt. Additionally if you succeed the check by 10 or more the creature's spell fails and has no effect. When you use this feature you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Daemonic Weapon
entries: At 10th level you perfect the rites learned from forbidden lore to bind a Daemon within a weapon, granting it—and by extension you—a modicum of its power.

You can transform one non-magical weapon into your daemonic weapon by performing a special ritual while you hold the weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest. When you do so, choose one of the options from the list available on the {@filter Other Options & Features|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Daemonic Entity} page.

Additionally it counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage and you have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. However whenever you roll a natural 1 you must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save your current and maximum hit points are reduced by {@damage 1d10}. The reduction to your hit point maximum lasts until you finish a short or long rest.
The weapon ceases being your daemonic weapon if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different weapon, or if you cast remove curse on the weapon; either way the weapon becomes mundane once again.

subclassFeature.name: Undead Puppetry
entries: At 15th level as an action you may command a number of humanoid corpses or piles of bones within 30 feet of you, up to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), to rise and become {@creature zombie|MM|zombies} or {@creature skeleton|MM|skeletons} under your control.
The undead creatures are under your control for 1 minute or until the this effect ends, at which point they become dead once again.
While they are under your control and within 30 feet of you, you can continue this effect and command them on your turn as a bonus action.

A single command can be issued to as many of your undead minions as you wish and can be specific, like directing their movement and what action they will take, or be more general, as in guarding a person or place. They will continue to follow your orders until they are complete or the effect ends, but if you don't command them at all, they will do nothing except defend themselves against attack.
You must finish a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Awakened Daemonic Weapon
entries: At 18th level the entity bound within your daemonic weapon awakens, granting it greater power.
The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it increases to +3 and it gains a new effect based on the entity bound within.

subclass.name: Monster Hunter
subclassFeatures: Veteran of the Long Hunt|Inquisitor|FoxfireInquisitor|Monster Hunter|FoxfireInquisitor|18

hp.special: equal the beast's Constitution modifier + five times your inquisitor level (the watcher has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your inquisitor level)

trait.name: Pack Tactics (Hound Only)
entries: The Watcher has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Watcher's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Loyal Bond
entries: You can add your proficiency bonus to any ability check or saving throw that the Watcher makes.

trait.name: Flyby (Crow Only)
entries: The Watcher doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The watcher has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight, hearing or smell.

action.name: Maul (Hound Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 1 + PB} slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Peck (Crow Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4 + 2 + PB} piercing damage.

monster.name: Daemonhost
languages: Celestial or Sylvan depending on its type

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The daemonhost has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The daemonhost's weapon attacks are magical.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The daemonhost's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, depending on its type, requiring no material components:

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

spell.name: Denial of Divinity
entries: You point at one celestial, fey or fiend you can see within range and loudly rebuke its existence. They must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 5d8} psychic damage.

Additionally a creature who takes 30 or more psychic damage from this spell must make a Charisma saving throw at the start of their next turn; on a failed save, you banish it. If the target is native to a different plane of existence than the one you're on, the target disappears, returning to its home plane. If the target is native to the plane you're on, the creature vanishes into a harmless demiplane. While there, the target is {@condition incapacitated}. It remains there until the end of your next turn, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Sacred Mercy
entries: Choose a number of creatures you can see within range up to your spellcasting modifier. For the duration of the spell each target regains 1 hit point at the start of their turn if they are within range and have no more than half of their hit points left.
However if a target starts their turn with 0 hit points and within range, they instead become stable if they are not already and the spell ends for them.
This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the healing increases by 1 for each slot level above 3rd.

m.text: holy water worth 25 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Warp Lightning
entries: A bolt of greenish-black lightning arcs toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} lightning damage and {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armour made of metal.

The spell creates more than one bolt when you reach higher levels: two bolts at 5th level, three bolts at 11th level, and four bolts at 17th level. You can direct the bolts at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each bolt.

spell.name: Wrack
entries: One creature of your choice you can see within range experiences a jolt of searing pain and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the target takes {@damage 1d4} psychic damage and {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage.
This spell's psychic and necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d4} each when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4} each), 11th level ({@damage 3d4} each), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4} each).

optionalfeature.name: Archdevil's Ruby
entries: You can cast {@spell hellish rebuke} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Black Mask
entries: As a bonus action you activate this relic and gain advantage on {@skill Sleight of Hand} or {@skill Persuasion} Checks for 10 minutes. You are unable to use this relic again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Fire Amulet
entries: As an action you target a creature you can see within 30 feet of you and cause its blood to superheat within its veins, exploding out in jets of searing vermillion ichor. The target must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 8d8} fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Additionally your current and maximum hit points are reduced by {@dice 1d10} and you are unable to use this relic again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Bloody Skull Medallion
entries: You can cast {@spell haemorrhage|AdvancedArcaneries} once using a inquisitor spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Broken Thigh Bone
entries: As a bonus action you activate this relic and gain advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws for 1 hour; however you also gain disadvantage on Intelligence checks and Intelligence saving throws. You are unable to use this relic again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Charred Antlers
entries: When you make a roll with disadvantage, you may re-roll one of the {@dice d20}s and must use the new roll; however you gain disadvantage on one future roll of the DM's choosing. You are unable to use this relic again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Clawed Paw
entries: You can cast {@spell hunter's mark} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Drowned Severed Hand
entries: You can cast {@spell tidal wave|XGE} once using a inquisitor spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Flaming Hand Badge
entries: You can cast one {@filter 1st level spell from the Wizard spell list|spells|level=1|class=Wizard} (chosen when you choose this relic) once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Flayed Spellscar
entries: You can cast {@spell destructor/renewer|AdvancedArcaneries2} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Golden Wax Sun Seal
entries: You can cast {@spell planar binding} once using a inquisitor spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Hand of Domination
entries: You can cast {@spell dominate person} once using a inquisitor spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Jewelled Knife
entries: You can cast {@spell extract wealth|AdvancedArcaneries2} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Milky Quartz Eye
entries: You can cast {@spell arcane eye} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Nine-Barbed Ring
entries: You can cast {@spell lash of excess|AdvancedArcaneries2} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Obsidian Disc
entries: You can cast {@spell darkness} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Small Vellum Scroll
entries: As a bonus action you activate this relic and gain advantage on {@skill Arcana} or {@skill History} Checks for 10 minutes. You are unable to use this relic again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Snowflake Talisman
entries: You can cast {@spell cone of cold} once using a inquisitor spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Stone Spider Miniature
entries: You can cast {@spell web} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Tiny White Skull
entries: You can cast {@spell enervation|XGE} once using a inquisitor spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Teardrop Triangle Pin
entries: You can cast {@spell contagion} once using a inquisitor spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Tri-Lightning Bolt Pin
entries: You can cast {@spell call lightning} once using a inquisitor spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Two-faced Coin
entries: You can cast {@spell absorb impact|AdvancedArcaneries} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Waterfall Carving
entries: You can cast {@spell calm emotions} once using a inquisitor spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: White Skull Ring
entries: You can cast {@spell treason of change|AdvancedArcaneries2} once using a inquisitor spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Slaughter
entries: At 10th level the weapon has the following property:

entries.name: Rampage
entries: On your turn, when you score a critical hit with this weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with it, you can make one melee attack with it as a bonus action.
At 18th level the weapon gains the following property:

entries.name: Aura of Rage
entries: As an action you can unleash the rage of the entity within. For 1 minute you, and each creature within 10 feet of you, must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or make one melee weapon attack as a bonus action on their turn. A creature can choose to fail this saving throw.
The weapon can't be used this way again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Decay
entries: At 10th level the weapon has the following property:

entries.name: Neuropathy
entries: While wielding this weapon bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that you take from nonmagical attacks is reduced by 3.
At 18th level the weapon gains the following property:

entries.name: Putrefy
entries: As an action you can release the rot harboured by the entity within. For 1 minute you gain immunity to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks and any time a creature touches you or hits you with a melee attack while within 5 feet of you it takes {@damage 2d4} necrotic damage.
The weapon can't be used this way again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Excess
entries: At 10th level the weapon has the following property:

entries.name: Fleet
entries: While wielding this weapon you gain a +5 bonus to your initiative rolls and your movement speed increases by 10 feet.
At 18th level the weapon gains the following property:

entries.name: Glare
entries: As an action you can cause the weapon to gleam with the perfection of the entity within. For 1 minute, once per turn you can force a creature you hit with this weapon to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
The weapon can't be used this way again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Change
entries: At 10th level the weapon has the following property:

entries.name: Focus
entries: While wielding this weapon you can use it as a spellcasting focus, when you do so you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your inquisitor spells.
At 18th level the weapon gains the following property:

entries.name: Chaos
entries: When you cast an Inquisitor spell of 1st level or higher with this weapon as a focus, you can temporarily replace its damage type with another at random. Roll {@dice 1d8} for the new type: 1, Acid; 2, Cold; 3, Fire; 4, Force; 5, Lightning; 6, Poison; 7, Psychic; 8, Thunder.

optionalfeature.name: Hunger
entries: At 10th level the weapon has the following property:

entries.name: Ravenous
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon you gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt by that attack.
At 18th level the weapon gains the following property:

entries.name: Voracious
entries: As an action you can indulge the appetite of the entity within. For 1 minute, once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon you can deal an additional {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage and regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt.
The weapon can't be used this way again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Ruin
entries: At 10th level the weapon has the following property:

entries.name: Misfortune
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon you can force them to succeed a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or subtract your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 0) from the next saving throw it makes before the end of your next turn.
At 18th level the weapon gains the following property:

entries.name: Disaster
entries: As an action you can set loose the ruinous entity within. For 1 minute, once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon you can force them to succeed a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or have their AC reduced by an amount equal to your Wisdom modifier for 1 minute.
The weapon can't be used this way again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Luminous
entries: At 10th level the weapon has the following property:

entries.name: Radiance
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon you can deal an additional {@damage 1d8} radiant damage. Additionally as a bonus action you can cause the blade to shed bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.
At 18th level the weapon gains the following property:

entries.name: Winged
entries: As an action you can let the weapon take flight for 1 minute. The weapon hovers in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. If you can see the sword, you can command it as a bonus action to fly up to 50 feet and either make one attack against a target or return to your hands.
The weapon can't be used this way again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Deceit
entries: At 10th level the weapon has the following property:

entries.name: Glamour
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon you can force them to succeed a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or become charmed by you until the end of your next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the effect for the next 24 hours.
At 18th level the weapon gains the following property:

entries.name: Psychosis
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or suffer a {@variantrule madness|DMG|long-term madness effect}.
The weapon can't be used this way again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Inquisitorial Symbol of Office
entries: A symbol denoting the station of a particular inquisitor, which may consist of any design from personal heraldry to the symbol of a deity from their respective order.

entries.name: Inquisitor
entries: Grim and determined, the inquisitor roots out enemies of all kinds, using trickery and guile when righteousness and purity is not enough. Although inquisitors can be dedicated to particular deities as a clandestine part of the formal religious order, some simply follow their own sense of justice and are more than willing to take the most extreme measures to make sure justice, divine or not, is served.

Inquisitors tend to move from place to place, chasing down enemies and researching emerging threats. As a result, they often travel with others, if for no other reason than to mask their presence. Religious inquisitors may work with members of their faith whenever they can, but even such allies are not above suspicion as no one is truly innocent.

entries.name: Creating A Inquisitor
entries: An inquisitor's life is a harsh one, short on trust and forever engaging in a game of cat and mouse. How did you enter into such a life? Did your piety for your faith lead you to root out heretics and sinners? Were you assigned such a role in a time of great peril for your order? Or are you simply possessed of an unflinching moral backbone and could no longer stand the corrupt world you see around you?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make an inquisitor quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Wisdom your highest ability score. Second, depending on what fighting style you want to use, choose either Strength or Dexterity. Third, choose the {@background acolyte|PHB} background.

entries.name: Inquisitor Multiclassing
entries: Should you wish to multiclass into an inquisitor, the prerequisites and proficiencies gained are listed below.

entries.name: Ability Score Minimum
entries: Strength 13 or Dexterity 13, and Wisdom 13

entries.name: Proficiencies Gained
entries: Light armor, medium armor, shields, simple weapons.
